data.title: Executive Summary Report
data.subtitle: West Texas Wind Farm Feasibility Study
data.executiveSummary: The West Texas Wind Farm site demonstrates excellent potential for utility-scale wind energy development. Analysis of terrain, wind resources, and layout optimization indicates a viable project with 18 turbines generating 45 MW of capacity. The site benefits from strong southerly winds (average 7.2 m/s), minimal terrain obstacles, and good road access. Estimated annual energy production of 146.5 GWh with a capacity factor of 38% positions this project competitively in the regional market.
recommendations: Proceed with detailed engineering and permitting for 18-turbine layout
Conduct 12-month wind measurement campaign to validate resource assessment
Engage with local stakeholders and regulatory authorities for project approval
Optimize turbine spacing to reduce wake losses from 12.3% to target 8-10%
Secure grid interconnection agreement with local utility
data.reportHtml:
West Texas Wind Farm

Executive Summary

The West Texas Wind Farm site demonstrates excellent potential for utility-scale wind energy development...

Key Metrics

Technical Summary

ParameterValue
Number of Turbines18
Turbine ModelGeneric 2.5 MW
Hub Height80 m
Rotor Diameter100 m
Average Wind Speed7.2 m/s
Wake Losses12.3%

Recommendations

1. Proceed with detailed engineering and permitting
2. Conduct 12-month wind measurement campaign
3. Engage with local stakeholders
4. Optimize turbine spacing to reduce wake losses
5. Secure grid interconnection agreement
6. Develop construction timeline
